The the the the mediums for this influence were American philanthropic foundations, especially the so-called Big Three, Carnegie, Rockefeller and Ford, and they developed very sophisticated ways and producing political influences even when their stated goals were supposedly completely apolitical.
All three were founded in the early 20th century, Carnegie and Rockefeller, somewhat earlier, in 19 eleven, 1913, respectively.
